metadata.section_title: Exceptions to the list of visa nationals

chunks.text: ### Exceptions to the list of visa nationals
chunks.summary: This provision applies to visa nationals seeking entry under visitor rules. It outlines specific exceptions allowing certain nationals or circumstances to bypass standard visa restrictions, subject to conditions like purpose or duration of stay, with notable thresholds or criteria set out for eligibility.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Section ID: SW 3.1
Section: Exceptions to the list of visa nationals
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to visa nationals seeking entry under visitor rules. It outlines specific exceptions allowing certain nationals or circumstances to bypass standard visa restrictions, subject to conditions like purpose or duration of stay, with notable thresholds or criteria set out for eligibility.

### Exceptions to the list of visa nationals

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list

chunks.text:
### Holders of specified travel documents

1.   VN 2.1. It is not necessary for a Transit Visitor to hold an entry clearance before they travel to the UK if they are travelling on an emergency travel document issued by, and evidencing the nationality of, a country not listed in VN 1.1.(a) and the purpose of their transit is to travel to the country in which they are ordinarily resident.

1.   VN 2.2. The following people do not need a visit visa before they travel to the UK as a Visitor, other than where VN 2.3. applies: 
    1.   (a) nationals or citizens of the People’s Republic of China who hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or
    2.   (b) nationals or citizens of the People’s Republic of China who hold a passport issued by the Macao Special Administrative Region; or
    3.   (c) nationals or citizens of Taiwan who hold a passport issued by Taiwan that includes in it the number of the identification card issued by the competent authority in Taiwan; or
    4.   (d) people who hold a Service, Temporary Service or Diplomatic passport issued by the Holy See; or
    5.   (e) DELETED
    6.   (f) DELETED
    7.   (g) DELETED
    8.   (h) DELETED
    9.   (i) DELETED
    10.   (j) DELETED
    11.   (k) DELETED
    12.   (l) DELETED
    13.   (m) DELETED
    14.   (n) DELETED
    15.   (o) DELETED
    16.   (p) DELETED
    17.   (q) DELETED
    18.   (r) nationals or citizens of Botswana, who hold a confirmed booking to the UK made before 15:00 BST on 14 October 2025 where arrival in the UK is no later than 15:00 GMT on 25 November 2025.

1.   VN 2.3. VN 2.2. does not apply where the person is: 
    1.   (a) visiting the UK to marry or to form a civil partnership, or to give notice of marriage or civil partnership, unless they are a “relevant national” as defined in section 62 of the Immigration Act 2014; or
    2.   (b) seeking to visit the UK for more than 6 months.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to certain travel document holders and visa-exempt visitors. It specifies that Transit Visitors with emergency travel documents and certain nationals (e.g., Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, Holy See) do not require a visit visa, with some exceptions for specific nationalities like Botswana prior to a set time. These criteria ensure streamlined entry for designated travelers under defined conditions.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Section ID: 1
Section: Holders of specified travel documents
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: This provision applies to certain travel document holders and visa-exempt visitors. It specifies that Transit Visitors with emergency travel documents and certain nationals (e.g., Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, Holy See) do not require a visit visa, with some exceptions for specific nationalities like Botswana prior to a set time. These criteria ensure streamlined entry for designated travelers under defined conditions.

### Holders of specified travel documents

1.   VN 2.1. It is not necessary for a Transit Visitor to hold an entry clearance before they travel to the UK if they are travelling on an emergency travel document issued by, and evidencing the nationality of, a country not listed in VN 1.1.(a) and the purpose of their transit is to travel to the country in which they are ordinarily resident.

1.   VN 2.2. The following people do not need a visit visa before they travel to the UK as a Visitor, other than where VN 2.3. applies: 
    1.   (a) nationals or citizens of the People’s Republic of China who hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; or
    2.   (b) nationals or citizens of the People’s Republic of China who hold a passport issued by the Macao Special Administrative Region; or
    3.   (c) nationals or citizens of Taiwan who hold a passport issued by Taiwan that includes in it the number of the identification card issued by the competent authority in Taiwan; or
    4.   (d) people who hold a Service, Temporary Service or Diplomatic passport issued by the Holy See; or
    5.   (e) DELETED
    6.   (f) DELETED
    7.   (g) DELETED
    8.   (h) DELETED
    9.   (i) DELETED
    10.   (j) DELETED
    11.   (k) DELETED
    12.   (l) DELETED
    13.   (m) DELETED
    14.   (n) DELETED
    15.   (o) DELETED
    16.   (p) DELETED
    17.   (q) DELETED
    18.   (r) nationals or citizens of Botswana, who hold a confirmed booking to the UK made before 15:00 BST on 14 October 2025 where arrival in the UK is no later than 15:00 GMT on 25 November 2025.

1.   VN 2.3. VN 2.2. does not apply where the person is: 
    1.   (a) visiting the UK to marry or to form a civil partnership, or to give notice of marriage or civil partnership, unless they are a “relevant national” as defined in section 62 of the Immigration Act 2014; or
    2.   (b) seeking to visit the UK for more than 6 months.

chunks.text:
### Exception where the applicant holds an Electronic Visa Waiver (EVW) Document (Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates nationals or citizens only)

1.   VN 3.1. DELETED
2.   VN 3.2. DELETED
3.   VN 3.3. DELETED
chunks.summary: This provision applies to visa nationals from Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Saudi Arabia, and UAE holding an Electronic Visa Waiver (EVW). It allows these applicants to enter the UK without a standard visa under specific conditions outlined in the EVW scheme. Exceptions or specific requirements are subject to the EVW eligibility and validity criteria.

chunks.text:
### Obtaining an Electronic Visa Waiver Document

1.   VN 4.1. DELETED
2.   VN 4.2. DELETED
3.   VN 4.3. DELETED
chunks.summary: This provision applies to visa nationals applying for an Electronic Visa Waiver (EVW) document. Applicants must meet specific eligibility criteria to obtain the EVW, which allows entry without a standard visa. Critical conditions include complying with the designated travel routes and restrictions; certain nationals may be excluded or require different procedures.

metadata.section_title: Exception for minors on organised school trips from France

chunks.text:
### Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 18 or under on an organised trip from a school in France

1.   VN 7.0. Nationals or citizens of any country who are aged 18 or under, studying at a school or educational institution in France registered with the French Ministry of Education and seeking to enter the UK as part of a school party of 5 or more pupils organised by that school or institution, do not need entry clearance before they travel to the UK as a Visitor.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to visitors aged 18 or under from France on organised school trips. They do not require entry clearance if travelling as part of a school party of five or more organized by a registered French educational institution. No additional conditions are specified.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to visitors aged 18 or under from France on organised school trips. They do not require entry clearance if travelling as part of a school party of five or more organized by a registered French educational institution. No additional conditions are specified.

### Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 18 or under on an organised trip from a school in France

1.   VN 7.0. Nationals or citizens of any country who are aged 18 or under, studying at a school or educational institution in France registered with the French Ministry of Education and seeking to enter the UK as part of a school party of 5 or more pupils organised by that school or institution, do not need entry clearance before they travel to the UK as a Visitor.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
metadata.section_title: Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 19 or under on an organised trip from a school in Germany

chunks.text:
### Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 19 or under on an organised trip from a school in Germany

1.   VN 8.0. Nationals or citizens of any country who are aged 19 or under, studying at a school or educational institution in Germany, the existence of which is confirmed by the relevant German municipal or competent authority, and seeking to enter the UK as part of a school party of 5 or more organised by that school or institution, do not need entry clearance before they travel to the UK as a Visitor.

Print this page
chunks.summary: This provision applies to visitors aged 19 or under from Germany on organized school trips. Such individuals do not require entry clearance if they are part of a school group of five or more, recognized by German authorities. The exception is conditional on the trip being organized by a German school or institution.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Visitor: Visa national list
Section ID: VN 8.0
Section: Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 19 or under on an organised trip from a school in Germany
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to visitors aged 19 or under from Germany on organized school trips. Such individuals do not require entry clearance if they are part of a school group of five or more, recognized by German authorities. The exception is conditional on the trip being organized by a German school or institution.

### Exception where the Visitor is a person aged 19 or under on an organised trip from a school in Germany

1.   VN 8.0. Nationals or citizens of any country who are aged 19 or under, studying at a school or educational institution in Germany, the existence of which is confirmed by the relevant German municipal or competent authority, and seeking to enter the UK as part of a school party of 5 or more organised by that school or institution, do not need entry clearance before they travel to the UK as a Visitor.
